article_title: Japan Stocks Rally on Back of Asian Rebound
article_text:
Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average jumped the most in nearly seven years Wednesday, as a continuing rally in China and bullish comments from Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe helped trigger a squeeze on short positions.

The gains came on the back of a rebound across Asian markets, which analysts said prompted investors to go back into Japanese shares following a summer of selling.

The Nikkei Stock Average rose throughout the day,...

twitter.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average jumped the most in nearly seven years on Wednesday, as a rebound in regional markets, especially China’s, encouraged investors to scoop up sharply devalued stocks.
twitter.title: Japan Stocks Rally on Back of Asian Rebound
